author: Shalini Ramachandran
title: AMC’s Aging Hit ‘Walking Dead’ Loses Viewers, Crimping Ad Revenue
text:
AMC Networks Inc.’s advertising revenue fell sharply last quarter, as the television company’s hit program “The Walking Dead” shows its age in its eighth season.
For the fourth quarter, AMC’s revenue fell 0.4% because of ratings and advertising declines at its U.S. cable networks. But net income rose thanks to a one-time gain of $68 million related to corporate tax reform, as well as the absence of an impairment charge that had been recorded in the year-earlier quarter.
